snippet: Czech officers have used felt-tip pens to identify more than 200 migrants, angering human rights activists who see parallels to World War II.
abstract: Jewish groups and human rights advocates criticize authorities in Czech Republic for writing numbers on skin of 200 migrants pulled off train at Breclav railway station, saying that practice recalls Nazi practice of tattooing numbers on Jews in concentration camps.

byline.contributor: Dinah Spritzer contributed reporting from Prague.

lead_paragraph: Czech officers have used felt-tip pens to identify more than 200 migrants, angering human rights activists who see parallels to World War II.

headline.main: Numbering of Migrants by Czechs Brings Outcry
headline.print_headline: Numbering of Migrants by Czechs Brings Outcry

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
